bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, February 22, 1952

div1.p: Hench enjoyed his visit with Rodriguez Leon and her husband, and is amused that she congratulated him on the Finlay Medal before he knew he was to receive it. He will keep her informed on Camp Lazear preservation efforts.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, February 22, 1952
div1.opener:
February 22, 1952
Senora E. Agramonte de Rodriguez Leon
Calle K No. 254
Vedado, Havana
Cuba
My dear Senora:
div1.p:
It was indeed a pleasure for Mary and me to meet you and your good
husband Francisco. I would not consider a trip to Havana to be
complete without spending some time with you. My only regret is that
we were so busy with medical affairs this time.

On the way home I developed a nasty cold from which I am just re-
covering and today I go to Washington for a few days.

Your friend, Mr. Baker, wanted his boy to come here and I was anxious
to have it also so we have arranged for him to come. They will be
here next week when I return. Confidentially, I am rather worried
about the boy. I am afraid that he may have a progressive neuro-
muscular condition, but we shall see.

I am still amused to recall that you were the first to congratulate
me about the Finlay Medal when I didn't even know it was to happen.
That was a pleasant surprise.

I shall keep you informed about the plans for Camp Lazear. They gave me
a copy of the blue prints which are being copied while I am away and on
my return I will send you one with some comments.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
